sml:System.gml:description: MERIS is a programmable, medium-spectral resolution, imaging spectrometer operating in the solar reflective spectral range. Fifteen spectral bands can be selected by ground command, each of which has a programmable width and a programmable location in the 390 nm to 1040 nm spectral range.

swe:Count.gml:description: Number of bands on each camera

sml:Document.gml:description: Page of ESA Website describing the Envisat mission.
Page of ESA Website describing the MERIS Instrument.

sml:Term.sml:value: Camera 1 - Band 1 (412.5 nm) - Yellow substance and detrital pigments

swe:field.name: Across-Track Ground Sampling Distance at Nadir
Along-Track Ground Sampling Distance at Nadir

swe:Curve.gml:description: Spectral Response given as a table of wavelength vs. normalized power

Central wavelength for each pixel of the scan array. The deviation with regard to the nominal central wavelength of the band may result from misalignment of the scan array towards the axis of the diffraction or refraction element. This deviation is also called the "Smile effect".

sml:Term.sml:value: Camera 1 - Band 2 (442.5 nm) - Chlorophyll absorption maximum

swe:field.name: Across-Track Ground Sampling Distance at Nadir
Along-Track Ground Sampling Distance at Nadir

swe:Curve.gml:description: Spectral Response given as a table of wavelength vs. normalized power

Central wavelength for each pixel of the scan array. The deviation with regard to the nominal central wavelength of the band may result from misalignment of the scan array towards the axis of the diffraction or refraction element. This deviation is also called the "Smile effect".

sml:Term.sml:value: Camera 1 - Band 3 (490 nm) - Chlorophyll and other pigments

sml:Term.sml:value: Camera 1 - Band 4 (510 nm) - Suspended sediment, red tides

sml:Term.sml:value: Camera 5 - Band 2 (442.5 nm) - Chlorophyll absorption maximum
